Uses of Interface
progettose.ShapeInterface

    • Uses of ShapeInterface in progettose

      Classes in progettose that implement ShapeInterface 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  EllipseShape
      Class to manage the creation of an EllipseShape that is a wrapper for the real JavaFX shape : Ellipse
      class  LineShape
      Class to manage the creation of a LineShape that is a wrapper for the real JavaFX shape : Line
      class  RectangleShape
      Class to manage the creation of an RectangleShape that is a wrapper for the real JavaFX shape : Rectangle
      Methods in progettose that return ShapeInterface 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ShapeInterface EllipseCreator.createShape(double clickX, double clickY, javafx.scene.paint.Color interiorColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor, double width, double height)
      This method is used to create an ellipse Shape.
      ShapeInterface RectangleCreator.createShape(double clickX, double clickY, javafx.scene.paint.Color interiorColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor, double width, double height)
      This method is used to create a rectangle Shape.
      ShapeInterface SegmentCreator.createShape(double clickX, double clickY, javafx.scene.paint.Color interiorColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor, double width, double height)
      This method is used to create a segment Shape.
      abstract ShapeInterface ShapeCreator.createShape(double clickX, double clickY, javafx.scene.paint.Color interiorColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color borderColor, double width, double height) 
      Methods in progettose with parameters of type ShapeInterface 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void State.handleNext(ShapeInterface i) 
      void notselectedState.handleNext(ShapeInterface i)
      When called, it sets the selected property of the ShapeInterface object to true
      void selectedState.handleNext(ShapeInterface i)
      When called, it sets the selected property of the ShapeInterface object to false
